text: there are four things that I see people
doing to their skin which drive me crazy
first of all they are treating their
skin too harshly and what this means is
that they're actually using a washcloth
or they're using a facial brush of some
type and although these kind of can seem
like they're going to cleanse your skin
more in fact what they're doing is
really abrading your skin it's - they're
providing a little bit too much
exfoliation and what that can do is
actually lead to redness inflammation
and for some skin types even darker skin
types actually cause of darkening of
your face so this is something that you
really don't want to do the second thing
that I see people doing a lot is buying
really expensive products and really
expensive face cream you don't
necessarily need to buy something that's
super expensive particularly if you are
young a lot of people who are younger
want to get into anti aging lotions and
creams and you start using something
that's too heavy it's actually going to
break you out now I'm a big fan of
holistic and natural approaches but if
you're starting to use things like
alcohol to dry up a pimple or a very
strong witch-hazel solution you're going
to put yourself in a position where
you're actually causing more
inflammation and irritation to your skin
so not only do you now have a pimple but
then you have irritation around it which
is not going to be the best result
finally what people don't do is they
don't wear enough sunscreen you gotta
wear sunscreen every day an SPF 30 or
higher and one that's broad-spectrum
going to make a big difference even when
you think it's cloudy
